title: Ghosts In His Eyes
body:
by SinfulTrashChild

“Holy Water Can’t Help You Now
A Thousand Armies Can’t Keep Me Out
I Don’t Want You Money
I Don’t Want Your Crown
I’m Here
To Burn
Your Kingdom
Down”

-Midoriya Izuku to All Might on April 13, 2044

Words: 166, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Boku no Hero Academia, Yesterday Upon The Stair - Fandom
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings, Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Categories: M/M, Multi
  • Characters: Midoriya Izuku, Original Character 1, Orginal Character 2, Bakugo Kastuki, Todoroki Shouto, Todoroki siblings, All Class 1-A, Shinsou Hitoshi, Ojiro Mashirao
  • Relationships: Bakugou Katsuki/Todoroki Shouto, Dabi/Shigaraki Tomura | Shimura Tenko, Midoriya Izuku/Pain, Midoriya Izuku/Suffering, Ojiro Mashirao/Shinsou Hitoshi
  • Additional Tags: BAMF Midoriya Izuku, Villain Midoriya Izuku, Villain Shinsou Hitoshi, Fluff to the max, Mini, Whos Grape Boi, The only purple Boi I know is Shinsou, Who be GrapeDick cause IDK, I Wrote This Instead of Sleeping, Crack, Aoyama Yuuga is Best Boy, we all love Aoyama Yuuga, much crack, author hates life, Sociopath!Midoriya Izuku

summary: Iida music headcanons -he really likes old corny music like (You’re My) Soul and Inspiration, and also has the perfect voice for...
body:
Iida music headcanons

-he really likes old corny music like (You’re My) Soul and Inspiration, and also has the perfect voice for it

-whenever he starts singing, Todoroki and Midoriya join in. two people who can just barely sing and one who actually kinda can, belting it out like their lives depend on it. it’s glorious.

-since he’s into that genre, he is one of the few people who knows there is an original version of Hooked on a Feeling (along with Jirou, who just has a lot of music knowledge)

-Kaminari asks him to play Hooked on a Feeling one day, fully expecting ooga-chaka, and got cheesy 60′s goodness

-Kirishima, who likes supporting his friends even more than he loves ooga-chaka: this is cool, who sings it?

-Iida, who (1) knows the singer’s name is BJ Thomas and (2) knows what BJ means: d. don’t have a clue

-after Momo tells him she’s gay, he starts playing Lesley Gore at random moments and shouting “LESBIAN RIGHTS”. Momo is very touched.

-Tokoyami asks him to play “something good” one day, and Iida, who loves his friends and pays attention to their interests, plays The Crazy World of Arthur Brown. specifically, Fire. 

-Tokoyami, now kneedeep in old black and white videos on youtube and making a headdress to set aflame: I owe you my life

-he can play a couple brass instruments and the piano

-he does the When Mom Isn’t Home vine with Midoriya, who slams the oven door, and Todoroki, who taps his foot in the background. it’s one of their most treasured moments.

-whenever someone, for any reason, wants him to play an instrument, he does so with complete enthusiasm

-he is so happy to help his friends and boyfriends you don’t even know

-Jirou: yeah there’s this idea I have and a trumpet might sound nic-

-Iida, running at the speed of light: HELLO I’M HERE

summary: I've recently noticed something, I wanted to point out, and it's the way some people draw the BNHA girls. Like, for example,...
body:
I’ve recently noticed something, I wanted to point out, and it’s the way some people draw the BNHA girls. Like, for example, look at this:

This is what Tsuyu looks like in the manga, and anime:

And this is how people draw her:

Do you see the difference? I believe this is something that happens with all the female characters not just Tsuyu, and it bothers me. Why change her original appearance? Isn’t she already beautiful enough for them? It’s not just them. I’ve also seen art, depicting how the mutant characters such as Tokoyami and Shouji would look like without their mutations (the arms, and the bird head). Look, if you want to imagine what they would look like, “if they were human”, then fine. But, everyone should understand, that this is how Horikoshi drew them. What bothers me, are the people who try to change their original external appearances, because they think the characters are not “good enough”, and they all should have Shoto’s and Momo’s level of hotness. Let’s all accept that all the characters are beautiful the way they are, and stop all those artistic attempts, of making them look “sexier”. (And by the way, stop drawing Momo and Uraraka as if they were obesse for fuck’s sake. I’ve really seen art, where they represented both Uraraka and Momo as obesse girls. Please stop. They are just “chubby”. There’s a big difference between being chubby, and being horribly overweight).

They are just “chubby”. There’s a big difference between being chubby, and being horribly overweight).

summary:
Midoriya: *For the umpteenth time at the school infirmary*
Recovery Girl: What's your type-
Midoriya: Strong, blonde, handsome,...
body:
